metadata.title: CVE-2019-20395 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
A stack consumption issue is present in libyang before v1.0-r1 due to the self-referential union type containing leafrefs. Applications that use libyang to parse untrusted input yang files may crash.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-20395` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libyang-cpp1 - 1.0.176-1
libyang-tools - 1.0.176-1
libyang1 - 1.0.176-1
yang-tools - 1.0.176-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libyang package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.176-1').
